title: Gene Shell
text:
Eugene Franklin Shell (April 16, 1930 – October 8, 2020) was an American <a href="baseball">baseball</a>, <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, and <a href="American%20football">football</a> coach. He played <a href="college%20baseball">college baseball</a> and <a href="college%20basketball">college basketball</a> at <a href="Northeastern%20State%20University">Northeastern State</a> and <a href="Southwestern%20Oklahoma%20State%20University">Southwestern Oklahoma State</a>. He then served as the head baseball coach of the <a href="Tulsa%20Golden%20Hurricane%20baseball">Tulsa Golden Hurricane</a> from 1966 to 1980, leading the Golden Hurricane to a second-place finish in the <a href="1969%20College%20World%20Series">1969 College World Series</a>. He also was the head baseball coach of the <a href="Louisiana%20Ragin%27%20Cajuns%20baseball">Southwestern Louisiana Ragin' Cajuns</a> (1985–1987).
Early life.
Shell attended <a href="Central%20High%20School%20%28Tulsa%2C%20Oklahoma%29">Central High School</a> and <a href="Webster%20High%20School%20%28Tulsa%2C%20Oklahoma%29">Webster High School</a> in <a href="Tulsa%2C%20Oklahoma">Tulsa, Oklahoma</a>.
Coaching career.
Shell was head baseball coach at <a href="Edison%20Preparatory%20School">Edison Preparatory School</a>, Webster High School and <a href="Claremore%20High%20School">Claremore High School</a>, where he won five state championships. In 1965, Shell was hired to be an assistant football coach for <a href="Tulsa%20Golden%20Hurricane%20football">Tulsa</a>. He was asked to be an assistant basketball coach as well before he was offered the position of head baseball coach.
Shell died on October 8, 2020.
